parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Listening to, obedient, submissive. From hupakouo; attentively listening, i.e. submissive.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Or apothomai ap-o'-thom-ahee from apo and the middle voice of otheo or otho; to push off, figuratively, to reject.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
